title: Alexa Skills Kit Response
description:
The format of the response that your service returns. The service for an Alexa skill must send its response in JSON format. 
https://developer.amazon.com/public/solutions/alexa/alexa-skills-kit/docs/alexa-skills-kit-interface-reference#response-format

version.title: Version
version.description: The version specifier for the request with the value defined as: "1.0".

sessionAttributes.title: Session Attributes
sessionAttributes.description:
A map of key-value pairs. 
The key is a string that represents the name of the attribute. Type: string. 
The value is an object that represents the value of the attribute. Type: object.

response.title: Response
response.description: A response object that defines what to render to the user and whether to end the current session.

reprompt.title: Reprompt Speech
reprompt.description:
The object containing the outputSpeech to use if a re-prompt is necessary. 
This is used if the your service keeps the session open after sending the response, but the user does not respond with anything that maps to an intent defined in your voice interface while the audio stream is open. 
If this is not set, the user is not re-prompted.

shouldEndSession.title: Should End Session
shouldEndSession.description: A boolean value with true meaning that the session should end, or false if the session should remain active.

OutputSpeech.title: Output Speech Object
OutputSpeech.description: This object is used for setting both the outputSpeech and the reprompt properties.

type.title: Type
type.description:
A string containing the type of output speech to render. Valid types are: 
"PlainText": Indicates that the output speech is defined as plain text. 
"SSML": Indicates that the output speech is text marked up with SSML.

TextOutputSpeech.title: Text Output Speech Object
TextOutputSpeech.description: Output speech object for plain text.

type.title: Plain Text Type
type.description: Indicates that the output speech is defined as plain text.

text.title: Plain Text Text
text.description: A string containing the speech to render to the user. Use this when type is "PlainText"

type.title: SSML Text Type
type.description: Indicates that the output speech is text marked up with SSML.

ssml.title: SSML Text
ssml.description: A string containing text marked up with SSML to render to the user.

Card.title: Card
Card.description: The object containing a card to render to the Amazon Alexa App.

type.title: Card Type
type.description:
A string describing the type of card to render. Valid types are: 
"Simple": A card that contains a title and plain text content. 
"Standard": A card that contains a title, text content, and an image to display. 
"LinkAccount": a card that displays a link to an authorization URL that the user can use to link their Alexa account with a user in another system. See Linking an Alexa User with a User in Your System for details.

SimpleCard.title: Simple Card
SimpleCard.description: A card that contains a title and plain text content.

type.title: Card Type
type.description: A string describing the type of card to render.

title.title: Card Title
title.description: A string containing the title of the card. (not applicable for cards of type LinkAccount).

content.title: Card Content
content.description: A string containing the contents of a Simple card (not applicable for cards of type Standard or LinkAccount).

StandardCard.title: Standard Card
StandardCard.description: A card that contains a title, text content, and an image to display.

type.title: Card Type
type.description: A string describing the type of card to render.

title.title: Card Title
title.description: A string containing the title of the card. (not applicable for cards of type LinkAccount).

text.title: Card Text
text.description: A string containing the text content for a Standard card (not applicable for cards of type Simple or LinkAccount)

image.title: Card Images
image.description:
An image object that specifies the URLs for the image to display on a Standard card. Only applicable for Standard cards. 
You can provide two URLs, for use on different sized screens.

LinkAccountCard.title: Link Account Card
LinkAccountCard.description: A card that displays a link to an authorization URL that the user can use to link their Alexa account with a user in another system. See Linking an Alexa User with a User in Your System for details.

type.title: Card Type
type.description: A string describing the type of card to render.
